data.title: Fondation Henri Cartier
data.meta_description: Est. in 2003 by Henri Cartier-Bresson, his wife Martine Franck and their daughter the Foundation is one of the major photographic institutions in Paris.
data.text:
Rencontres

Le Feuilletage #7 | Gong Co. with Christian Patterson

Christian Patterson presents Gong Co. (Éditions Images Vevey & TBW Books, 2024), a long-form, monumental memento mori to the decline, death, and decay of a small grocery store in the heart of the Mississippi Delta. In this work, made over…

News

This summer, the Basil & Elise Goulandris Foundation pays tribute to Henri Cartier-Bresson and Martine Franck with several exhibitions in Greece

The Basil & Élise Goulandris Foundation presents two exhibitions in Athens. The first is devoted to Henri Cartier-Bresson’s Images à la Sauvette, recently republished by the Henri Cartier-Bresson Foundation. The exhibition features the 74 photographs that compose the famous publication.…

News

Bucerius Kunst Forum presents Henri Cartier-Bresson’s first major retrospective in Germany for 20 years

The Bucerius Kunst Forum presents the photographer’s first major retrospective in Germany for 20 years. The exhibition reveals not only his early photographs and cinematographic works influenced by surrealism, his political photo-reportages, but also his portraits of famous artists and…

News

The Fonds Hélène & Édouard Leclerc presents the first ever Henri Cartier-Bresson retrospective in Brittany.

The Fonds Hélène & Édouard Leclerc presents the first retrospective of Henri Cartier-Bresson in Brittany. Curated by Clément Chéroux, director of the Fondation Henri Cartier-Bresson, this exhibition of nearly 300 works, from the most famous to the lesser-known, is an…
